However, if you have already booked a ticket for the period of the new regulation before the new regulation takes effect, then the old regulation can apply.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Can workers or contractors claim travel expenses in accordance with the "Key Points for Reimbursement of Travel Expenses Abroad"?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Contractors can report foreign travel expenses in the same way as civil servants, but workers are not suitable for sending abroad, so they cannot claim foreign travel expenses.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Can agencies send technicians and workers abroad for inspection?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: It is not appropriate for various agencies to send technicians and workers abroad for inspection. Because the nature of their work is routine and does not involve the level of policy development and implementation. In addition, workers are not applicable to the key points of travel expenses for overseas business trips, and cannot report foreign travel expenses in the same way as civil servants.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Can temporary personnel who are not employed in accordance with the legal system of public servants be sent abroad for inspection when the agency needs it?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: According to relevant regulations, temporary personnel who are not employed in accordance with the legal system of public servants are not suitable to be sent abroad for inspection. Because the nature of their work is usually temporary and short-term, and it is different from the normal work of executive organs and official civil servants. In addition, the personnel sent on business trips abroad need to have the expertise and language skills to complete the mission abroad. In order to avoid excessive inspections abroad, considering the government's financial funds and the nature of the work of temporary personnel, it is not suitable for temporary personnel to be sent abroad for inspections.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Can the medical personnel employed by the medical operation fund perform international medical service cases sent abroad on business?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Yes, the medical personnel hired by the medical operation fund can perform international medical service cases sent abroad on business. However, the appropriateness of the use must be checked according to the "Key Points for Employment and Utilization of Temporary Personnel by the Executive Yuan and its affiliated agencies and schools", and the appropriateness of the use must be checked and dealt with according to powers and responsibilities.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: What kind of situation is a business trip?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Business trip refers to the situation where public servants go abroad to perform one of the following tasks after obtaining the approval of the head of the agency: first, to visit abroad at the official invitation of a foreign government, civil society or international organization; second, to conduct relevant visits in response to diplomatic needs; Three, participating in international conferences or negotiations on behalf of the government; four, going abroad for investigation or inspection due to business needs; fifth, other official duties.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: What are the conditions for approval of a business trip?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: The conditions for approval of business trips are that civil servants must be approved by the head of the agency and perform one of the following tasks: to visit abroad at the official invitation of a foreign government, civil society or international organization; to conduct relevant visits in response to diplomatic needs; to attend international conferences or negotiations on behalf of the government ; Going abroad for inspection or inspection due to business needs; or other official duties. In addition, there must be an annual plan and budget for going abroad, and the travel itinerary and number of days must be approved by the head of the agency.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: If it is a public holiday registration, can I claim foreign travel expenses?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: If the public holiday registration belongs to the nature of the business trip stipulated above, such as performing one of the five tasks listed in point 2, having an annual plan and budget for going abroad, and the head of the signing agency approves the business trip itinerary and the number of days, then Foreign travel expenses can be claimed. However, if the nature of the business trip does not meet the above regulations, you cannot claim the expenses.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: If during a business trip abroad, during the peak tourist season, you cannot book a return ticket within the approved business holiday, can you apply for reimbursement for the living expenses during the delayed return period?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: During the peak tourist season during a business trip abroad, if you cannot book a return ticket within the approved business holiday, you cannot apply for reimbursement for living expenses during the delayed return period. Because "it falls in the peak tourist season" does not fall into the category of "illness or accident", living expenses cannot be claimed.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: What kinds of expenses are included in the travel expenses?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Travel expenses include transportation expenses, living expenses and office expenses. Transportation expenses refer to the expenses required by air, ship and long-distance public land transportation; living expenses include accommodation expenses, meals and pocket expenses; office expenses include going abroad handling fees, insurance fees, administrative fees, gift exchanges and miscellaneous expenses.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Transportation fee refers to the expenses required by which means of transportation?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Transportation expenses refer to the expenses required for mission personnel to take planes, ships and long-distance public land transportation.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: What costs are covered by living expenses?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Living expenses include accommodation, meals and pocket expenses. Minor expenses include urban train ticket fees, urban bus ticket fees, urban MRT ticket fees, personal credit card handling fees, laundry fees, tips and other living-related expenses.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: What are the types of expenses for office expenses?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Office expenses include handling fees, insurance premiums, administrative fees, gift communication fees and miscellaneous expenses for business travelers going abroad.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: If you need to rent a car for a business trip, from which project should the expense be reimbursed?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: If you need to rent a car for a business trip, the cost can be reimbursed from the gifts, communication and miscellaneous expenses.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Is there a specific definition or standard for long-distance mass land transportation?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: There is no specific definition or standard for long-distance mass land transportation. According to the key points for claiming travel expenses for foreign business trips, the cost of long-distance public land transportation for business travelers can be claimed. As for whether it is a long-distance mass land transport vehicle, it should be judged by the business travelers and their service agencies in accordance with relevant regulations, and verification of rights and responsibilities should be carried out.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: How to report expenses for long-distance public land transport?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: In order to report the cost of taking long-distance public land transport, the original documents or travel agency collection and transfer receipts must be attached.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: What class of seats can ministers and special envoys take when traveling on business?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: When ministers and special envoys are on business trips, they can take first-class seats (cabins).

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: What kind of cabin can be used by undersecretaries with diplomatic missions to visit or attend important international conferences?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Undersecretaries with diplomatic missions can take the first-class seat (cabin) when they go abroad or attend important international conferences.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: If the person on business trip is at the eleventh grade of the junior rank, concurrently serves as the supervisor of the permanent task organization and receives the bonus of the supervisor of the twelfth rank of the junior rank, can he take the business class or equivalent seat (cabin)?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: OK. If the person on business trip is sent abroad because of concurrently serving as a supervisor of the twelfth grade in the permanent task organization, he can take a business class seat or a seat of equivalent class according to the main points of overseas travel expenses. However, it depends on the reason for the business trip and the content of the job, and handle it according to the main points of travel expenses for foreign business trips.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Business travelers can take business class, but there are only two options of first class and economy class on the route, can they take first class?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: When business travelers can take business class, if there are only two options of first class and economy class on the route, they cannot take first class and can only choose economy class.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: When the heads of municipalities and counties (cities) go abroad, which level of standards can they refer to when taking transportation?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: The remuneration of the mayor of the municipality directly under the central government can be compared with the standard of the ministerial level to take the transportation, while the treatment of the county (city) mayor can be used according to the standard of the deputy minister. However, depending on fiscal or budgetary considerations, local governments may make savings within these standards.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: When the colleagues of Academia Sinica go abroad, how is the standard of claiming the cabin class of the plane determined?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: When colleagues from the Academia Sinica go abroad, the cabin class reimbursement standard for boarding the plane mainly refers to the key points for travel expense reporting abroad. According to regulations, ministerial personnel and special envoys can take the first-class cabin; deputy ministerial personnel, ambassadors, foreign representatives, ministers, other special-appointed (assigned) personnel, and personnel with full supervisory bonuses above the twelfth rank of the junior post can take the first-class cabin. Business Class or equivalent; and the rest in Economy (Standard) Class. As for the academicians of the Academia Sinica, due to their special status and unpaid positions, they can take business or equivalent seats in the same way as "other specially appointed (assigned) personnel". For the rest of the staff, please follow the stipulations in point 21 of the reporting points and handle it within the scope specified in point 5.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: If you should take an economy (standard) seat (class) when you go abroad, and if you buy a full-price economy class ticket, can you claim the payment?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Purchasing a full-price ticket for economy class is different from the stipulated economy (standard) seat (class), so the travel expenses for business trips abroad still need to be reported for economic (standard) seat (class) according to the regulations.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: I need to report the transportation expenses for the flight on a business trip. What documents should I attach?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer:
When reporting transportation expenses by air on a business trip, the following documents need to be attached:
1. Ticket stubs or e-tickets or other documents sufficient to prove the itinerary.
2. Proof of purchasing an international airline ticket or travel agency collection and transfer receipt or other documents with sufficient funds to prove the payment of the ticket.
3. The boarding pass stub (including the electronic boarding pass) or a photocopy of the passport with sufficient evidence to prove the fact of going abroad or the boarding certificate issued by the airline.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: May I ask how the daily allowance of living expenses for personnel traveling abroad is allocated?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: The distribution method of the daily living expenses of personnel traveling abroad is as follows: accommodation expenses account for 70%, meal expenses account for 20%, and pocket expenses account for 10%.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: If the business trip is in a city that is not listed in the "Living Expenditure Amount Table", how to calculate the living expenses of the business traveler?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: If the business trip is in a city that is not listed in the "Living Expenditure Amount Table", the living expenses can be calculated based on the nearest country in the table. If it is a city in the same country but not listed on the table, it can be paid according to the last item "Other" in the country's quota table.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Do I need to provide vouchers for verification of accommodation expenses, meals and pocket expenses?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: When claiming living expenses, it is generally not necessary to provide vouchers. However, under certain circumstances, such as being designated as a hotel when attending an international conference or negotiation on behalf of the government, or traveling to a war-torn area identified by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, and the accommodation fee exceeds a certain percentage of the daily living expenses in the area, you need to provide proof verification Pay for accommodation.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: How should living expenses be calculated if the applicant travels across two regions or more than two regions within one day?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: When a business traveler crosses two or more regions within one day, the calculation standard of living expenses shall be based on the region where he or she stays on the day, and double calculation shall not be allowed.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Should the agency entrust a travel agency to handle air tickets, accommodation and other items for overseas inspections, should it follow the provisions of the Government Procurement Law?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Yes, if the agency entrusts a travel agency to handle items such as air tickets and accommodation for overseas inspections, it shall follow the provisions of the Government Procurement Law. If the agency handles it in the name of the agency, regardless of whether air tickets, accommodation and other items are entrusted in whole or in part, they must abide by the Government Procurement Law. However, if the staff of the agency take care of themselves and report travel expenses according to the key points for reporting travel expenses abroad, the Government Procurement Law does not apply.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Can the part of the actual expenses paid to the travel agency that exceeds the standard daily living expenses be used for personal pocket expenses?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Can't. The actual expenses paid to the travel agency can only be used for accommodation and meal expenses. If the part exceeds the daily standard of living expenses, it belongs to the savings of agency expenses and should not be used for personal pocket expenses. Personal pocket expenses shall be reported according to the percentage (10%) listed in the daily standard of living expenses.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: If personnel are sent abroad on business, does the government procurement law apply to the air tickets and accommodation fees handled by the travel agency?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: If an agency sends personnel abroad for business purposes, handles air tickets, accommodation and other items in the name of the agency, and entrusts a travel agency to do so, the provisions of the Government Procurement Law shall apply. However, if the agency personnel take care of themselves and report travel expenses in accordance with foreign travel regulations, the Government Procurement Law does not need to apply.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: If the hotel arranged by the organizer is not in the same place as the meeting place, can the accommodation fee still be reimbursed?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Yes, according to regulations, the hotel and the venue do not have to be in the same place, and the accommodation fee can still be reimbursed.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: An international meeting refers to a governmental or non-governmental meeting involving how many countries?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: An international meeting refers to a bilateral or multilateral, governmental or non-governmental meeting involving two or more countries.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: If I am not attending an international conference or negotiation, but I am staying in a hotel arranged by the organizer, can the accommodation expenses be reimbursed according to the main points of foreign travel expenses?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: If you are not attending an international conference or negotiation, but you are staying in a hotel arranged by the organizer, the accommodation fee cannot be reimbursed according to the key points of foreign travel expenses. Only under certain circumstances, such as attending international conferences or negotiations, or jointly visiting foreign countries with private enterprises, participating in exhibitions, and ministerial personnel visiting abroad, can the expenses be reported according to the key points of foreign travel expenses. In other cases, business travelers need to handle the accommodation expenses by themselves within the daily living expenses.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: If a foreign government or an international organization provides accommodation during a business trip, how can we claim our living expenses?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer:
If a foreign government or an international organization provides accommodation during a business trip, the method of claiming living expenses will be in accordance with the following regulations:

1. If board and lodging is provided, and there is no other cash allowance, or the cash allowance does not reach 10% of the local daily living expenses, you can pay daily or make up 10% of the local daily living expenses for pocket expenses.

2. If only meals are provided, no accommodation is provided, and there is no other cash allowance, or the cash allowance does not reach 10% of the local daily living expenses, you can pay 70% of the local daily living expenses for accommodation, and 10% of the local daily living allowance is paid or supplemented for pocket expenses.

3. If only accommodation is provided, no meals are provided, and there is no other cash allowance, or the cash allowance does not reach 10% of the local daily living expenses, you can pay 20% of the local daily living expenses for meals on a daily basis, and 10% of the local daily living allowance is paid or supplemented for pocket expenses.

On the day of returning to the country, the living expenses shall be reported within the limit of 30% of the daily living expenses in the area.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: How to claim for the meals provided by the airline ticket during a business trip?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: According to the main points of foreign travel expenses declaration, the meals provided by you in the means of transportation do not need to be deducted. Therefore, the airline meals provided by the ticket do not need to be reported, and no relevant expenses need to be deducted.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: How to calculate the living expenses if you leave the country in the morning and return to the country in the evening on the day of the business trip?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: If you leave the country in the morning on the day of the business trip and return to the country in the evening, in this case, according to the provisions of the key points for reporting travel expenses for foreign business trips, the living expenses only need to be calculated according to the daily living expenses of the place where you stay on that day. Finally, the calculated living expenses can be claimed.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: How much can we claim for meals if only accommodation is provided but no meals are provided?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: If only accommodation is provided but no meals are provided, you can report the meal expenses according to 20% of the daily living expenses in the area.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: How to claim living expenses for business travelers who spend the night on the plane?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Business travelers who spend the night on the plane can claim living expenses within 30% of the daily living expenses in the departure area.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: If I spend the night at the airport or on the plane on the last day of a business trip, how to claim the living expenses?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: If you spend the night at the airport or on the plane on the last day of the business trip, if no meal or cash allowance is provided, you can claim 30% of the daily living expenses in the departure area.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: The accommodation fee for attending an international conference already includes breakfast, so how to reimburse living expenses?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Since breakfast is included in the accommodation fee for attending international conferences, the breakfast part should be deducted from the original daily living expenses in accordance with regulations when reimbursement of living expenses is made. Specifically, the breakfast and meal expenses are 4% of the daily living expenses. Therefore, when you are reimbursed for living expenses, you can deduct this percentage and calculate the remaining percentage.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: How to report the living expenses on the day of returning to the country?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: The living expenses on the day of returning to the country are reported according to 30% of the daily living expenses in the area.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: How to calculate the transportation expenses within the area (city) where the business trip is located?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: The part of the transportation fee should be handled according to the provisions of this point.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: In which ratio should I report the expenses of meals and pocket expenses not within the scope of the area where I am stationed?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Meal expenses and pocket expenses not within the scope of the resident area shall be reimbursed at 30% of the daily living expenses in the area.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Are there any special regulations for accommodation within the area of ​​residency?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: The special regulations for lodging within the area of ​​​​residence are that, in principle, you must go back and forth within one day without lodging. However, if it is necessary to stay in a hotel, in addition to complying with the provisions of point 8, the accommodation fee can be reported within 70% of the daily living expenses in the area.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: If it is necessary to stay in a hotel, what is the limit for the accommodation fee?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: The limit of accommodation expenses is 70% of the local daily living expenses.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Are these provisions included in the relevant interpretations?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Not included in the relevant explanation.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: How is the living expense reimbursement calculated for a business trip in the same place for more than one month?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: The cost of living expenses for a business trip in the same place varies according to the length of stay. If the residency is longer than one month but less than three months, from the second month onwards, the living expenses shall be reported at 80% of the daily allowance in the area. If the stay exceeds three months, starting from the fourth month, the living expenses will be reported according to 70% of the daily allowance in the area.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: If you need to ask for leave to return to your country during a business trip, how should you calculate the period of stay?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: If you need to ask for leave to return to your country during the business trip, you must deduct the number of days you asked for leave, and then calculate the business trip period before and after the leave, which is your residency period.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: What are the exceptions to the living expenses discount for long-term business trips?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: There are three exceptions to the living expenses discount for long-term business trips, namely: attending international conferences or negotiations on behalf of the government, being dispatched to areas identified by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs as red alert for foreign travel, and planning to open embassies, consulates, representative offices or offices.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: If you go on a business trip abroad for 6 months, how should you report the living expenses for the second and third months?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: If you go on a business trip abroad for 6 months, the living expenses for the second and third months should be reported according to 80% of the prescribed amount.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: How can I apply for living allowance if I get sick or encounter an accident during the business trip and the business trip exceeds the scheduled days?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: If you get sick or encounter an accident during the business trip, which causes the number of business trips to exceed the scheduled time, you need to provide a definite proof and get the approval of the head of the agency. After approval, you can claim the living allowance according to the daily standard.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: During public holidays, if you have to stay at home or abroad due to flight problems, how should you report for board and lodging expenses?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: During public holidays, if you need to stay at home or abroad due to flight problems, you can report the board and lodging expenses according to the regulations in the "Key Points for Claiming Travel Expenses for Foreign Business Trips" and "Key Points for Claiming Expenses for Domestic Business Travel Expenses". Under the principle of ensuring non-duplication of receipts, the reimbursement shall be verified in accordance with foreign and domestic regulations. Remember to operate within the tolerance period.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: What regulations are followed for the reimbursement of board and lodging expenses for the foreign and domestic parts?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: The overseas part of the board and lodging expenses is reported in accordance with the "Overseas Business Travel and Travel Expense Reporting Key Points", while the domestic part of the board and lodging expenses is reported in accordance with the "Domestic Travel and Travel Expense Reporting Key Points".

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: What fees are included in the handling fees for business travelers going abroad?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: The handling fees for business travelers going abroad include passport fees, visa fees, yellow book fees, vaccination fees, foreign exchange settlement fees and airport service fees.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: If the visa documents cannot be provided, how should I apply for financial reimbursement?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: If the visa documents cannot be provided, you can issue a proof of expenditure according to the 4th and 7th points of the key points for handling expenditure documents, explaining the reason why the documents cannot be obtained, and then apply for payment based on this proof.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Can the cost of photo affixed to the passport be reimbursed?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: The cost of the photo attached to the passport cannot be reimbursed, because it does not belong to the scope of the passport fee.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: What is the process for civil servants to apply for free issuance of ordinary passports?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: If public servants want to apply for free issuance of ordinary passports, they need to attach an official letter from the dispatching agency, and explain the reason and schedule of the business trip in the official letter. Then submit an application to the Consular Affairs Bureau of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs or various offices of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. According to the business trip schedule, the Consular Affairs Bureau will issue a passport with a validity period of 1 to 5 years. In this way, there is no need to report the passport fee after applying for an ordinary passport according to the 13th point of the "Key Points for Claiming Travel Expenses Abroad".

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Can public service personnel apply for the issuance of ordinary passports for free on business?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Under certain circumstances, public service personnel can apply for the issuance of ordinary passports for free on business. If they are entrusted by the central competent authority to go abroad to participate in international conferences or engage in international exchange activities, they can submit an official letter from the central competent authority to apply to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs for free issuance of ordinary passports valid for 1 to 5 years. However, if you go abroad for activities related to the company's profit-making operations, you cannot apply for free issuance of ordinary passports.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Can personnel from public and private colleges and universities apply for the issuance of ordinary passports for free on business?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Yes, when personnel from public and private colleges and universities represent the Chinese government to participate in international conferences or conduct international exchange activities, they can apply to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs for issuing ordinary passports for free on business, and must attach a copy of the official letter from the competent authority.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Who decides the items and amount of insurance for business travelers?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: The insurance items and coverage for business travelers are determined by the Executive Yuan.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Which insurance items should be insured for business trips abroad?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: The insurance items that business travelers should insure include six items: accidental death, accidental disability, accidental injury medical treatment, air travel, disease hospitalization medical treatment, and military disaster insurance (applicable to the Middle East, El Salvador, Guatemala and other areas at risk of war) .

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: How much is the comprehensive insurance coverage for business travelers?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: The comprehensive insurance coverage for business travelers is NT$4 million.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Can I choose other insurance companies to insure?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Yes, if the insurance amount is the same and the insurance fee is lower, the institution requesting insurance can negotiate with another insurance company that offers more favorable conditions. However, it must be handled in accordance with the relevant provisions of the Government Procurement Law, and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the General Office of Personnel and Administration of the Executive Yuan will be notified of the situation.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: What are the different insurance items and amounts for business travelers in the Schengen area of ​​the EU?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: According to the regulations of the Executive Yuan, the insurance items and amount of business trips to the Schengen area of ​​the EU still need to be insured for "accidental death and disability" of 4 million yuan, "accidental injury medical care" of 1.4 million yuan, and "overseas sudden illness" of 1.4 million yuan .

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: What costs should be included in the travel administrative fee?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: The administrative expenses for business trips need to include the necessary materials, registration, registration, post and telecommunications, translation and shipping fees when performing official duties abroad.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: What should I do if there is a temporary business need that exceeds the original approved expenses during a business trip abroad?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: When traveling abroad, if the original approved expenses are exceeded due to temporary business needs, you can explain the reasons first, and then report to the head of the agency for approval. After approval, you can report the expenses together.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Is it possible to reimburse the credit card processing fee for paying the travel permit fee and registration fee for a business trip abroad with a personal credit card?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: OK. According to the regulations, if the organizer requires a personal credit card to pay the travel permit fee and registration fee for a business trip abroad, the credit card handling fee can also be reimbursed. However, if there is no restriction on the payment method, the payment method with the lowest fee should be selected.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: If there are multiple payment methods to choose from, which one should you choose?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: If there are multiple payment methods to choose from, you should choose the one with the lowest fee.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Does the deputy director of the agency meet the definition of a director-level person?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: If the deputy director of the agency falls under the definition of deputy chief and is already the eleventh grade and the twelfth grade, then he meets the definition of director-level personnel.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Does the total number of members include the leader of the group?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Yes, the total number of members includes the leader of the group.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: If the travel expenses are not borne by government agencies, can they still be counted in the total number of members?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: According to the main points of foreign travel expenses reporting, the number of members is the public servants of the specified country, and the travel expenses are borne by government agencies. In this case, if the travel expenses are not borne by the government agency, it cannot be counted in the total number of members.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: How should the head of the municipality and county (city) government follow the main points of foreign travel expenses for the gift communication and miscellaneous expenses abroad?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: The remuneration of the mayor of the municipality directly under the Central Government is compared with the remuneration standard of the minister-level personnel. Therefore, in terms of transportation, gifts, communication and miscellaneous expenses, the minister-level standard can be used to report expenses. The remuneration of the county (city) mayor is compared with that of the sub-minister level, and is paid according to the salary scale of the fourteenth post of the senior officer, so you can refer to the sub-minister level standard for reporting expenses. Local governments can use it prudently within the scope of the above standards based on fiscal or budgetary considerations.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: What are the standards for reporting gifts, communication and miscellaneous expenses for county (city) mayors, deputy county (city) mayors, and supervisors of first-level government affairs units?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: The county (city) mayor's standard for reporting gifts, communication and miscellaneous expenses is "sub-ministerial level", and the standard for reporting expenditures for deputy county (city) mayors and heads of first-level administrative units is "director-level personnel."

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Are the gifts and miscellaneous expenses only used by the person leading the group? Do I need to attach the list of donated objects?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: There are no restrictions on gift communication and miscellaneous expenses, only those who lead the group can use it, and there is no need to attach a list of gift recipients. It is stipulated in the key points of overseas travel expenses declaration that submitting the original documents for reimbursement does not limit the gift object, nor does it require the submission of supporting materials such as the list of gift objects. Business travelers should verify the reimbursement in good faith, but if each agency has internal planning and budget implementation specifications, it will be handled in accordance with the internal implementation specifications.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Does the gift fee need to indicate the recipient? Are there any restrictions? If you are a domestic employee, can you claim the expenses?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: In principle, there is no need to indicate the recipient of the gift fee, and there are no restrictions on the recipient. Business travelers should verify the reimbursement in good faith, but if each agency has internal planning and budget implementation regulations, it must be handled in accordance with the regulations. As for whether domestic personnel can claim their expenses, their relevance to the implementation of the plan to go abroad must be considered, and it is up to the responsible unit to judge.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Can personnel stationed abroad claim gifts, communication and miscellaneous expenses when traveling on business?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Under certain circumstances, personnel stationed abroad may claim for gifts, communication and miscellaneous expenses. According to the key points of foreign travel expenses reporting, if the personnel stationed abroad are called to travel in the country, because they have not left the country from the country, they are not allowed to report gifts, communication and miscellaneous expenses. However, if personnel stationed abroad go on a business trip to a country other than where they are stationed in accordance with the regulations, because they have already left the country from the country, they can claim gifts, communication and miscellaneous expenses. However, if the personnel stationed abroad are accompanied by personnel above the director level to go abroad, they must still follow the relevant regulations of the key points.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: When a travel agency travels abroad on behalf of the traveler, can the business traveler receive gifts, communication and miscellaneous expenses on a daily basis?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: According to the key points of foreign travel expenses reporting, if the business trip is not accompanied by personnel above the director level, they can report miscellaneous expenses of NT$600 per person per day according to the number of days of business trip. If you buy a group package (handled by a travel agency), whether you can receive miscellaneous expenses under different circumstances should be determined according to the relevant regulations on gifts and social expenses.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: . Can gift communication and miscellaneous expenses be reported on a daily basis per person? Do the documents have to be foreign?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Gifts, communication and miscellaneous expenses can be reported on a daily basis per person, but must be handled within the total amount. As for the documents, according to the regulations, according to the actual needs of foreign business trips, domestic and foreign documents can be submitted for payment.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: .Does the miscellaneous expense report for foreign business trips include the transportation expenses for the domestic itinerary (departure and return)?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Miscellaneous expense reports for foreign business trips do not include transportation expenses for domestic trips (starting trips and return trips). Miscellaneous expenses mainly refer to various expenses required in foreign countries. As for the transportation expenses incurred in the country, please follow the relevant regulations in the "Key Points for Claiming Travel Expenses for Domestic Business Trips".

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: .Do I need to add the item purchased, the recipient and the time when claiming the gift fee?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: When reporting gift expenses, according to the 16th point of the "Overseas Business Travel Expense Reporting Points", there is no explicit requirement to add the items purchased, recipients and time. However, when reporting expenses, the reporting should be verified in accordance with the principle of good faith. In addition, if the agency has internal planning and budget implementation regulations, it needs to be handled in accordance with the regulations.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: If the date of my departure is different from the date of my dispatched business trip, which day should I use as the benchmark when calculating the exchange rate?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: If the date of your departure is different from the date of the dispatched business trip, the calculation of the exchange rate shall be based on the day before the actual departure. If that day is a holiday, advance to the nearest weekday.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: I paid the registration fee with a credit card, can I use the credit card statement as a proof of payment?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: The credit card statement cannot be used as a payment voucher, because it is only an account notification from the bank to the credit card holder, and it does not meet the requirements of the government's expenditure voucher processing points. The proof of payment of the registration fee should still be handled in accordance with the regulations.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Why is the daily living expenses table for business travelers denominated in US dollars?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: The table of daily living expenses of business travelers is denominated in US dollars, mainly considering that the US dollar is a single and universal currency, which can facilitate the uniform expression of daily living expenses in various regions.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: If the foreign exchange has been settled before the business trip, should I use the foreign exchange settlement exchange rate or the spot exchange rate on the day before the departure when reporting expenses?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: If the foreign exchange has been settled before the business trip, you can use the foreign exchange settlement rate to handle the payment. If you have not settled foreign exchange, you need to use the spot exchange rate on the day before you go abroad to report the payment.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Why use the spot exchange rate instead of the cash exchange rate for foreign travel expenses?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: The main reason for using the spot exchange rate for travel expenses abroad is that banks usually use cash exchange rates for exchange in practice, but because banks have certain costs for holding cash, there will be differences between the cash exchange rate and the spot exchange rate. In the case of no over-the-counter transaction, the cash exchange rate cannot be used, and only the spot exchange rate can be used to enter the account. Therefore, if a business traveler handles the foreign exchange settlement before going abroad, he can report the payment according to the foreign exchange settlement rate; if he does not complete the foreign exchange settlement, he must use the Taiwan bank to sell the spot dollar reference exchange rate (spot exchange rate) the day before going abroad to process the payment.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Can public servants be reimbursed for their travel expenses if they enter the mainland without a report?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: If civil servants enter the mainland without a report, their travel expenses cannot be reimbursed. Because they have not completed the relevant approval process.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: If I take part in overseas training in a city not listed in the "Table of Daily Amounts of Living Expenses for Personnel Sent by Central Government Organs to Foreign Regions on Business", can I pay living expenses according to the nearest city?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: If the city where you are attending the training course is not listed in the "Table of Daily Amounts for Living Expenses of Personnel from Central Government Agencies on Business Trips to Various Regions Abroad", you can pay living expenses according to the city closest to the city. However, if the city is located in a country that has been included in the table, such as the United States, living expenses should be reported according to "Other" in the United States.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: If the foreign training institution only provides accommodation, but provides some cash allowances, how should I calculate and report my daily living expenses abroad?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: In your case, foreign training institutions provide accommodation, but they also provide cash allowances. The first step is to confirm the nature of the cash allowance, including whether it covers meals, pocket money or both. If the cash allowance includes meal expenses and pocket money, you can calculate the difference between the meal expenses and pocket money based on 40% of the daily living expenses; % of the daily allowance for living expenses, and then make up 30% of the daily living expenses to calculate the difference in meal expenses; if the cash allowance only includes pocket money, then 30% of the daily living expenses can be reported for meal expenses, and then make up the daily living expenses 10% of the amount to calculate the difference in petty cash. Accordingly, you can calculate and report daily living expenses abroad according to your actual situation.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: On the day of connecting flights, if I need to stay overnight on the vehicle, how should my living expenses be calculated?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: If you need to spend the night on the vehicle on the transfer day, your living expenses will be reimbursed according to 40% of the daily living expenses in the area.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: As an observer studying abroad, am I eligible for the "Subsidy Items and Amount Table for Personnel Sent Abroad for Advanced Study, Research and Internship by Central Government Agencies (including Institutions)"? Can I claim living and miscellaneous expenses on this form?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer:
As an observer studying abroad, you are subject to the "Subsidy Items and Amounts for Personnel Sent Abroad by Central Government Agencies (including Institutions) for Studying, Researching, and Internships". According to the regulations, each academic year’s internship and transportation expenses shall be paid by each agency according to the pre-approved plan. The transportation expenses shall be reported according to the actual vouchers, and the living expenses shall be reported according to the daily payment amount table, and repeated payment is not allowed.

As for the miscellaneous expenses, according to regulations, gifts, communication and miscellaneous expenses cannot be reported. Therefore, you can report living expenses according to this form, but not miscellaneous expenses.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: When calculating exchange rates for trainees abroad, should we use the exchange rate of the day before departure?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Yes, when foreign trainees settle their expenses after returning to China, they should follow the provisions of point 18 of the main points for foreign business trip travel expenses (the current regulation is point 19), that is, those who have not settled foreign exchange before leaving the country should pay One day before going abroad, the Taiwanese bank sells the spot US dollar with reference to the exchange rate as the basis for the reimbursement.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Should the period of studying abroad be calculated by the date of departure and return or by the actual study period? If the return home is delayed due to weather or flight delays, how will the subsidy be paid?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: The period of study abroad should be calculated by the date of departure and return, including the actual study period. If the return home is delayed due to factors not attributable to the person concerned, such as weather or flight delays, as for the subsidy for further repairs abroad, you can refer to the relevant regulations in point 12 of the key points for travel expenses for foreign business trips.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: If I intern in different places in two states of the United States for two weeks, when I switch to the second place, can I use the "Those who have been abroad for less than 15 days are sent to various foreign regions for business trips by the central government agencies every day?" What is the provision for the full payment of the "Table of Daily Expenditures for Personnel Living Expenditures"?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: According to regulations, if the internship period exceeds 15 days, it is not recommended to change the training location and then re-apply the full payment of the "daily living expenses table for personnel sent by various agencies of the central government to foreign regions on business trips" from the first day. Even if you intern for two weeks each in two states, you cannot use the provision again.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: If the government cooperates with foreign universities to organize classes and provide accommodation, can the amount of living expenses after paying the accommodation fee be fully distributed to the trainees for their own use?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Regarding the situation that the government cooperates with foreign universities to run classes and provide accommodation, the amount of living expenses after paying the accommodation fee can be distributed to the trainees for their own use. The main purpose is to reduce the financial pressure of the trainees so that they can concentrate on their studies. In addition, each competent authority can also check and disburse according to the funding situation.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Compilation of Interpretations by the Executive Yuan
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: During training abroad, if I stay in a hotel designated by the organizer, can I submit the payment of the accommodation fee for verification?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: The reimbursement of expenses for participating in foreign training courses should be handled in accordance with the provisions of the subsidy items and amount table for personnel sent by central government agencies (including institutions) to go abroad for advanced studies, research, and interns. In this regulation, there is no mention of the part that can be checked and verified to report the payment of accommodation expenses. This is because those who go abroad for advanced studies, research, and internships are part-time and paid, and the government adopts a subsidy nature for this plan to go abroad, and the government bears the public expenses of the personnel sent abroad (that is, the key points for reporting travel expenses abroad) approach is different. Therefore, in this case, it is impossible to verify the reported accommodation expenses.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Court regulations
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: What are the categories of the nature of overseas cases, including field investigation and data collection?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: There are many types of cases of going abroad, such as participation in international academic conferences, advanced studies, research, internships, etc. Field investigations, data collection, interviews, and experiments are also included, but whether they belong to the two attributes of "research" or "other official duties" needs to be further clarified.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Court regulations
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: What regulations should each institute or research center follow when preparing foreign funds?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: When preparing foreign funds, each institute or research center should report expenses according to the "Key Points for Reporting Expenditures for Foreign Business Travel Expenses" and "Subsidy Items and Amounts for Personnel Sent Abroad by Central Authorities for Advanced Study, Research, and Internships".

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Court regulations
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: How to avoid excessive expansion of foreign funds and being questioned?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: To avoid overexpansion of foreign funds and being questioned, it can be suggested that each institute (division, research center) set a subsidy upper limit for each plan to go abroad.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Court regulations
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: It is suggested to set a subsidy upper limit, how should each institute or research center set this upper limit?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: In order to avoid excessive foreign funding, when setting the upper limit of subsidies, each institute or research center can set a reasonable upper limit of subsidies based on the expenditures of past overseas plans and taking into account the nature and needs of research.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Court regulations
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: The definition of the nature of "research" is too broad. How should it be adjusted to make it more practical?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: To make the definition of the nature of the activity "research" more practical, we can subdivide it into different subcategories, such as fieldwork, data collection, interviews, and experiments. In this way, each unit can better plan and report expenditures for specific research activities when formulating funds. At the same time, it is recommended that the Personnel Office delete the overly broad definition to clarify the nature of research activities.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Court regulations
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: If I am studying abroad and need to take public transportation across cities, what are the regulations for reporting expenses?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: If you need to take public transportation across cities for further study abroad, whether it is an official budget, subsidy or entrusted plan, you can check and verify the transportation expenses, and you can also pay the comprehensive subsidy at the same time. So your transportation expenses can be reimbursed.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Court regulations
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: In order to save public money, do I need to buy air tickets together?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Yes, in order to save public funds, the air tickets of relevant personnel going abroad need to be purchased in a unified manner.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Court regulations
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Regarding the reimbursement of travel expenses for business trips abroad, if you represent the government to attend international conferences or negotiations, can you claim the expenses if the accommodation expenses exceed 70% of the daily living expenses in the region?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Yes, if you represent the government to attend international meetings or negotiations, you can report the payment after submitting the certificate if the accommodation expenses exceed 70% of the daily living expenses in the area. However, it should be noted that this rule only applies to meetings attended by the government of the country as the invited unit, such as WHO, APEC and other meetings. This provision does not apply if the individual attends an academic conference as a researcher.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Court regulations
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Is it only when the government of the country is the invited unit, such as attending WHO, APEC and other meetings, can it be counted as representing the government to attend international conferences?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Yes, only when the government of the country is invited to participate in meetings such as WHO and APEC, can it be counted as representing the government to attend international conferences. This rule does not apply to academic conferences that researchers are invited to attend in their personal capacity.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Court regulations
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: If a researcher is an individual invited to attend an academic conference, can the above-mentioned regulations on accommodation expenses be applied?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Researchers who are invited to attend academic conferences in their personal capacity do not apply to this accommodation expense reporting policy. This regulation mainly applies to the situation of representing the government to attend international conferences, such as attending WHO or APEC meetings.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Court regulations
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: What documents do I need to attach when applying to leave the country?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: When applying to go abroad, you need to attach relevant documents of the actual business trip city, such as meeting agenda or invitation letter.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Court regulations
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Can foreign travel expenses be used for foreign education and training expenses?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Yes, foreign travel expenses can be used for foreign education and training expenses. But it should be noted that foreign education and training expenses cannot be diverted to foreign travel expenses, and the total of the two cannot exceed the total budget.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Court regulations
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Can foreign education and training expenses be diverted to foreign travel expenses?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: No, foreign education and training expenses cannot be used for foreign travel expenses.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Court regulations
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Does the total amount of execution of the two exceed the limit of the total amount of budget?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: The total execution amount of the two shall not exceed the limit of the total budget.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Court regulations
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: If there is still not enough money after using it, can I apply to the hospital for the overall fundraising or budget control surplus support?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: Yes, if it is still not enough after using it, you can attach the implementation status and other materials, and apply to the hospital for overall fundraising or budget control surplus support.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Court regulations
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: What information do I need to provide when applying for overall fundraising or budget control surplus support?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: When applying for overall funding or budget control surplus support, it is necessary to provide relevant information such as the implementation situation.

Expenses for foreign business trips.title: Court regulations
Expenses for foreign business trips.question: Is the living expenses reimbursement standard for business trips based on the actual business trip city or the actual accommodation city?
Expenses for foreign business trips.answer: The living expenses reimbursement standard for travel expenses is based on the actual city of the business trip, not the actual city of accommodation.

General expense reporting.title: Court regulations
General expense reporting.question: If I want to participate in business-related professional skills training, do I really need to report to the department for approval?
General expense reporting.answer: Yes, if the professional skills training you want to participate in is funded by the institute, you only need to get the approval of the supervisor of the unit before you can ask for leave to attend the training. However, if it is general basic skills training, or if the funds are paid by the hospital, then it needs to be reported to the hospital for approval.

General expense reporting.title: Court regulations
General expense reporting.question: How much is the maximum amount of breakfast per person for the in-house seminar?
General expense reporting.answer: The breakfast fee can be reported up to 100 yuan per person.

General expense reporting.title: Court regulations
General expense reporting.question: If I want to report the meal expenses of the venue outside the hospital, what regulations should I follow?
General expense reporting.answer: If you want to report the meal expenses of the venue outside the hospital, you must follow the regulations of the Executive Yuan.

General expense reporting.title: Court regulations
General expense reporting.question: How much can I claim for table dishes for important domestic and foreign guests?
General expense reporting.answer: Table dishes for important domestic and foreign guests can be reported up to 10,000 yuan.

General expense reporting.title: Court regulations
General expense reporting.question: What is the price limit for eco-bento?
General expense reporting.answer: The price limit for eco-bento is 140 yuan.

General expense reporting.title: Court regulations
General expense reporting.question: If there are special circumstances and you want to increase the standard of meal charges, how do you apply?
General expense reporting.answer: If you want to increase the standard of meal fees under special circumstances, you need to sign and report to Academia Sinica for approval, and the increase can only be made after obtaining the approval.

General expense reporting.title: Court regulations
General expense reporting.question: How long in advance should I apply to hold important international academic and forward-looking planning conferences outside the school?
General expense reporting.answer: To hold important international academic and forward-looking planning conferences outside the school, you need to apply two months in advance.

General expense reporting.title: Court regulations
General expense reporting.question: What are the standards and restrictions for the reimbursement of board, lodging and transportation expenses?
General expense reporting.answer: The upper limit of the accommodation fee is 3,600 yuan per person per day. If it exceeds this standard, you have to pay it yourself, and you can no longer claim it. The upper limit of meal expenses is 1,800 yuan per person per day. Similarly, the excess must be borne by oneself. As for the cost of snacks and drinks, the upper limit is 80 yuan per person per time. In terms of transportation costs, the principle is mainly based on tour buses or public transportation.

General expense reporting.title: Court regulations
General expense reporting.question: What kind of conferences are identified as important international academic conferences?
General expense reporting.answer: Important international academic conferences are identified by the Academic Advisory Council of the Academy based on the conference topics and the academic status of the invited scholars.

General expense reporting.title: Court regulations
General expense reporting.question: What does a forward planning meeting mean?
General expense reporting.answer: The Foresight Planning Conference is to plan the future, conceive innovative directions and research strategies, so the directors and relevant personnel of various institutes and research centers will be invited to participate in the conference.

General expense reporting.title: Court regulations
General expense reporting.question: Is it possible to buy souvenirs or promotional items for attendees when holding such meetings?
General expense reporting.answer: Can't. When holding important international academic conferences and forward-looking planning conferences, it is not allowed to buy souvenirs or promotional materials for participants.

General expense reporting.title: Court regulations
General expense reporting.question: Can our conferences and lecture training be held outside the hospital?
General expense reporting.answer: In principle, conferences and lectures and training should be handled within the agency. However, if necessary, you can consult the local or nearby institutions or training institutions for venues. However, the board, lodging and transportation expenses per person should not exceed the standards stipulated in the key points for domestic travel expenses. In addition, when handling meetings and lectures and trainings, avoid bringing your family members to participate and buying unnecessary souvenirs.

General expense reporting.title: Court regulations
General expense reporting.question: If it is done at a public venue or a training institution, can the expenses be reimbursed?
General expense reporting.answer: Yes, if the activities are held at public venues or training institutions, the board, lodging and transportation expenses reported by each person shall, in principle, not exceed the travel expenses standard stipulated in the key points for domestic travel expenses.

General expense reporting.title: Court regulations
General expense reporting.question: Can participants bring family members along?
General expense reporting.answer: No, the regulations clearly state that family members are not allowed to participate.

General expense reporting.title: Court regulations
General expense reporting.question: Is it not allowed to buy souvenirs for participants?
General expense reporting.answer: Yes, no souvenirs or giveaways are permitted for participants other than those required to be awarded.

General expense reporting.title: Court regulations
General expense reporting.question: Should non-governmental organizations donated by the government follow the same regulations?
